JUDGES: András Sajó;Guido Raimondi;Helen Keller;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , PERSON ( “ the first applicant ” ) and PERSON ( “ the second applicant ” ) , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE and lived in GPE and GPE , respectively .
CARDINAL . Both applicants were represented before the ORG by ORG , a human rights organisation based in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the first applicant married PERSON , and during their marriage she gave birth to their CARDINAL children .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant and PERSON were divorced by consent before ORG in GPE . The first applicant ’s children were awarded child maintenance , while the first applicant herself never sought maintenance from her former husband .

CARDINAL . The first applicant maintained that after the divorce she and PERSON were reconciled and started living together again . In DATE that followed , they continued living as cohabitants ( vanbračni drugovi ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON died as a consequence of an accident at work .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant filed a request with the Pensions and ORG ( “ the NORP ” ) , requesting to be awarded a survivor ’s pension .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ’s branch in GPE rejected the first applicant ’s request , finding that she had no standing to claim a survivor ’s pension .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ’s ORG confirmed the decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decisions of DATE and DATE , while acknowledging that the first applicant and her former husband had continued living as cohabitants . ORG further explained that the first applicant was not entitled to a survivor ’s pension since in the divorce proceedings she had not been awarded maintenance ( see paragraph CARDINAL below , LAW of ORG ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant acquired the right to a disability pension .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant married FAC

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in GPE dissolved their marriage , noting , inter alia , that the parties had stopped living together in DATE . The applicant ’s children were awarded child maintenance , while the applicant herself never sought maintenance from her former husband .

CARDINAL . The second applicant maintained that following the divorce she and FAC continued living together as cohabitants , and that their children were never aware that their parents were in fact not married .
CARDINAL . NORP Throughout this partnership the second applicant was never employed , and enjoyed benefits based on FAC ’s health insurance .
CARDINAL . On DATE FAC died .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant filed a request with the ORG , seeking a survivor ’s pension .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ’s branch in GPE rejected the second applicant ’s request , since in the divorce judgment she had not been awarded maintenance ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ’s ORG confirmed the decision of DATE , acknowledging that the second applicant and her former husband had continued living as cohabitants .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE ORG and ORG respectively upheld the decision of DATE . On DATE the second applicant received ORG decision , rejecting her appeal on points of law ( zahtev za vanredno preispitivanje sudske odluke ) on its merits . ORG explained that the second applicant was not entitled to a survivor ’s pension since the divorce court had not awarded her maintenance ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . According to the documents contained in the case file , throughout the above proceedings , the applicants argued that they were entitled to their survivors’ pensions , respectively , since they had continued living with their former spouses and the latter had also continued providing them with maintenance on a voluntary basis .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL guaranteed equality between children born inside and outside of marriage .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL stated that all international human rights treaties valid in the territory of GPE and GPE would be directly applicable .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provided , inter alia , that all human rights guaranteed by a binding international treaty would be directly applicable .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that all ratified international human rights treaties shall be directly applicable .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that “ [ a]ll direct or indirect discrimination based on any ground , particularly on the grounds of race , sex , national or social origin , birth , religion , political or other opinion , property status , culture , language , age , mental or physical disability shall be prohibited . ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that “ a cohabiting partnership ( vanbračna zajednica ) shall be equal to marriage , under the conditions set forth by law ” .
CARDINAL . This LAW entered into force on DATE .

CARDINAL . The right to a survivor ’s pension shall be granted , inter alia , to family members of a deceased insured person who had paid the relevant contributions for DATE , as well as to family members of a person who had already been granted a pension ( Article CARDINAL ) . Eligible family members shall include , inter alios , the married partner ( bračni drug ) of the deceased ( LAW ) . The right to a survivor ’s pension shall likewise apply to a divorced partner ( bračni drug iz razvedenog braka ) , where a court had already established his or her right to maintenance in the course of the divorce proceedings ( LAW ) .

CARDINAL . A survivor ’s pension shall be granted to the deceased ’s children under DATE . Beyond that , children shall be entitled to the said pension if they are attending secondary or higher education , but even then only until DATE and CARDINAL respectively . Where the children ’s education has been interrupted due to a disease , they shall be entitled to the pension for an additional period corresponding to the duration of the disease in question . When the children ’s education has been interrupted because of their military service , the pension shall be paid until DATE . Should the children becomes unable to live and work independently before reaching the relevant age , they shall be entitled to a pension , but should the children become unable to do so only later , but before the insured parent dies , they shall be entitled to a pension only if they had been financially supported by that parent until his or her death . Such children , as well as disabled children , shall also be entitled to a pension should they become unemployed or otherwise cease with their business activities ( DATE ) .
CARDINAL . Should one acquire a right to a disability pension , CARDINAL shall no longer be entitled to a survivor ’s pension ( ORG CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL , taken together ) .
CARDINAL . One ’s entitlement to a pension or disability insurance ( osnov osiguranja ) can not be established on the basis of witness statements ( LAW ) .

CARDINAL . The latest amendments to the LAW entered into force on DATE , introducing certain changes to the pension and disability benefits system , mostly relating to the retirement age . When the question of the possibility to grant cohabitants equal rights in respect of the survivor ’s pension was raised , the ORG Secretary in ORG , who was at the same time the head of the working group on pension reform , was quoted as having said , “ it is hard to prove the existence of such partnerships ” ; “ [ i]ntroducing this right would mean a higher number of retired persons , and an increase in expenses ” ( PERSON , in a statement to the “ Press ” newspaper , DATE ) .

CARDINAL . Articles CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL , taken together , provide that cohabitants of deceased veterans shall , under certain conditions , be entitled to a survivor ’s disability pension ( pravo na porodičnu invalidninu ) if they have children in common .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides that compulsory health insurance shall be provided to the family members of the insured . Cohabitants are considered to be immediate family and are granted equal rights to married partners on the condition that they have shared a household for DATE before filing the request .

CARDINAL . This Act , read in conjunction with ORG , provides , inter alia , that cohabitants and married partners alike shall enjoy equal treatment as regards the Government - supported programme of in vitro fertilisation .
CARDINAL . Articles CARDINAL , CARDINALa and CARDINAL provide that cohabitants shall be treated the same as married partners in respect of their entitlement to various welfare benefits .

CARDINAL . DATE defines cohabitation as a longer partnership ( trajnija zajednica života ) between a man and a woman , where there are no obstacles to them marrying ( for example , another marriage , blood relationship and so on ) , and where the partners have the same rights and duties as those afforded to married partners , “ under the conditions set forth in this LAW ” .

CARDINAL . ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL provide that cohabitants shall have the right to request maintenance from CARDINAL another , and that any property obtained during their partnership shall be their common property .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL , taken together with Article CARDINAL , provides that cohabitants shall also be jointly responsible for certain obligations incurred during their partnership .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that the deceased ’s children and married partner shall inherit equal shares of his or her estate .

CARDINAL . This Act makes no reference to cohabitants . ORG , however , found that CARDINAL cohabitant does not have the right to inherit the property of the other following his or her death ( judgment of DATE , Gž . No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Articles CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL provide , inter alia , that should an appeal on points of law be accepted by ORG , the impugned decision may be overturned or quashed , and that in the latter case a re - trial before the lower court may be ordered .

CARDINAL . Cohabitants and married partners enjoy equal treatment as regards , inter alia , the following : ( a ) deciding on whether to donate their deceased partner ’s organs to medical institutions for educational purposes ( LAW , Zakon o zdravstvenoj zaštiti ; published in OG RS nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL ; Article CARDINAL ) ; ( b ) the assessment of whether an official can be deemed to be in a conflict of interest ( ORG , Zakon o sprečavanju sukoba interesa pri vršenju javnih funkcija ; published in OG RS no . CARDINAL , Article CARDINAL ) ; ( c ) an official ’s obligation to report his or her property and financial status to ORG ( ORG , Zakon o LOC borbu protiv korupcije , published in ORG RS nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL/CARDINAL , LAW ) ; and ( d ) various procedural contexts , civil and criminal ( see LAW , PERSON o krivičnom postupku , published in ORG of GPE nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL/CARDINAL , as well as in ORG RS nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL , Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL § DATE , CARDINAL § CARDINAL , CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL § CARDINAL ; see also LAW , Zakon o parničnom postupku , published in ORG RS nos . CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . LAW ( Zakon o strancima ; published in OG RS no . CARDINAL ) provides that temporary residence ( DATE ) may be granted to immediate family members for reasons of family reunification ( LAW ( CARDINAL ) ) . This includes , inter alios , married partners ( LAW ) . In practice , however , cohabitants have the same rights .

CARDINAL . There is no possibility , according to NORP legislation , to officially register a cohabiting partnership , nor does there exist an equivalent of , or a document similar to , the family record book .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected a motion seeking , inter alia , to have LAW declared unconstitutional . It did so because it lacked the power to legislate ( “ PERSON ... ne stvara normu ... [ , on ] ... nema ulogu i ovlašćenje tzv . pozitivnog zakonodavca ... ” ) . In its reasoning , however , ORG further opined as follows :

“ ... [ T]he ORG notes that the LAW ... has established that cohabitation is equal to marriage in accordance with the law ... [ It has therefore ] ... decided to send a letter ... to the ORG in which it will point out the need for the contested provisions of LAW ... to be brought in line ... with the LAW and ratified international instruments . ”
